titleInfo.title: Letter to George Washington Campbell from John Coffee

subject.topic: United States. Indian Removal Act of 1830

mods.abstract: A one page letter written on May 8, 1814 and sent from Huntsville, Alabama. Coffee notes the vast amount and the value of country newly acquired as a result of the conquest of the Creek nation. He offers his services as a surveyor to lay out and survey these new lands.
mods.accessCondition: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. titleInfo.title: Dyas Collection of John Coffee Papers
